activities.name: Persistent Staging Processing
activities.description: This pipeline process extract data from source system and copy into data lake landing zone and process staging

properties.description: This pipeline hold actual processing logic

sqlReaderQuery.value:
SELECT [controlid],
       [sourcename],
       [sourcedatabase],
       [sourceschemaname],
       [sourcetablename],
       [StagingSchemaName],
       [StagingTableName],
       [PersistentStagingSchemaName],
       [PersistentStagingTableName]       
       [incrementalload],
	   [sourcecolumns],
	   [watermarkcolumn],
	   [watermarkvalue],
           [KeyColumn],
       CASE
         WHEN [incrementalload] = 'Y' THEN
         'Select ' + [sourcecolumns] + ' From '
         + [sourceschemaname] + '.' + [sourcetablename]
         + ' Where ' + [watermarkcolumn] + ' >' + ''''
         + CONVERT(VARCHAR, Cast(COALESCE(watermarkvalue, '01/01/1900') AS
         DATETIME),
         120)
         + ''''
         ELSE 'Select ' + [sourcecolumns] + ' From '
              + [sourceschemaname] + '.' + [sourcetablename]
       END     AS SourceQuery,
       'data' AS DataLakeRootFolder,
       [datalakefolder],
       [PersistentStagingStoredProcName],
       [lastrefreshedon],
       [lastrefreshstatus]
FROM   [Control].[ingestionconfig]
WHERE  1 = 1
       AND [enabled] = 'Y'
       AND [frequency] = '@{pipeline().parameters.pLoadType}'
       AND [SourceName] ='@{pipeline().parameters.pSourceSystem}'
      -- AND [Module]='@{pipeline().parameters.pModule}'

import pyodbc

import uuid

from datetime import datetime

input_phone_number = []
input_user_permission_group = []
input_user_account = []
input_email = []
input_emergency_contact = []
input_address = []
input_job = []
input_working_rights = []

    record_phone_number['FullNumber']= '+8-' + str(record_phone_number['Number'])
    record_phone_number['IsPrimary'] = fake.boolean()

    record_user_permission_group = {}

content.query:
IF NOT EXISTS (SELECT * FROM sys.external_file_formats WHERE name = 'SynapseParquetFormat') 
	CREATE EXTERNAL FILE FORMAT SynapseParquetFormat
	WITH ( FORMAT_TYPE = PARQUET)
;

IF NOT EXISTS (SELECT * FROM sys.external_file_formats WHERE name = 'QuotedCsvWithHeaderFormat') 
    CREATE EXTERNAL FILE FORMAT QuotedCsvWithHeaderFormat
    WITH (  
        FORMAT_TYPE = DELIMITEDTEXT,    
        FORMAT_OPTIONS ( PARSER_VERSION = '2.0',FIELD_TERMINATOR = ',', STRING_DELIMITER = '''', FIRST_ROW = 2 )
    );

	IF NOT EXISTS (SELECT * FROM sys.external_data_sources WHERE name = 'storagedatalakehouse') 
	CREATE EXTERNAL DATA SOURCE storagedatalakehouse
	WITH (
LOCATION   = 'https://dapsatest01.dfs.core.windows.net/data')
;

DROP EXTERNAL TABLE dbo.product;

CREATE EXTERNAL TABLE dbo.product (
    id FLOAT,
    title NVARCHAR(20),
    description NVARCHAR(20),
    price FLOAT,
    discountPercentage FLOAT,
    rating FLOAT,
    stock FLOAT,
    brand NVARCHAR(200),
    category NVARCHAR(200),
    thumbnail NVARCHAR(200)
) WITH (
         LOCATION = '/DataSources/API/Data.csv',
         DATA_SOURCE = storagedatalakehouse,
         FILE_FORMAT = QuotedCsvWithHeaderFormat
);

Properties.Description:
A categorization of costs.

Ex:
- Variable Cost
- Fixed Cost
- Semi-Variable Cost

NewEntity.Name: CostType
NewEntity.Description:
A type of cost associated with an activity, item or asset.

Ex:
- Capital Cost
- Investment Cost
- Operating Cost
- Personnel Cost
- Recruitment Cost
- Regulatory Cost
- Land Cost
- Construction Cost
- Installation Cost
- Equipment Cost
- Maintenance Cost
- Fuel Cost
- Labor Cost

Variable costs are costs that vary in proportion to the changes in levels of activity or volume of production.

Ex:
- Supplies
- Fuel
- Electricity
- Spoilage
- Defects
- Travel (Airfare)
- Lodging
- Meals
- Supplies
- Office Rental
- Office Supplies
- Equipment Rental
- IT Equipment
- Telephone and Telecom
- Workshops / Meetings
- Security
- Chemical Cost
- Cleaning Cost
- Deep Well Injection Cost 
- Energy Cost
- Environmental Cost  
- Membrane Cost
- Off-Site Treatment Cost
- Water Disposal Transportation Cost
- Water Hauling Transportation Cost
- Water Replacement Cost

Fixed costs do not change in total regardless of the number of activities performed or level of activities.

Ex:
- Property taxes
- Depreciation of plant and equipment
- Insurance

Semi-variable or mixed costs contain both a fixed element and a variable component.

Ex:
- Supervision
- Quality inspection
- Utilities
- Fringe Benefits
- Maintenance and repairs
- Compensation insurance
- Payroll taxes
- Rentals

NewEntity.Name: EmissionWasteType
NewEntity.Description:
The type of emission waste:

Ex:
- cardboard
- food waste
- waste water
- solid waste
- third-party disposal waste

Emissions from waste depend on the type of waste being disposed of, and the waste diversion method. 

Companies should collect:

- Waste type-specific and waste treatment-specific emission factors. The emission factors should include end-of-life processes only. Emission factors may include emissions from transportation of waste.

Columns.Name: GlobalLocationNumber
Columns.Description: The Global Location Number (GLN) is a simple tool used to uniquely identify locations. It can be used to identify physical locations such as a warehouse, legal entities, or a function / department within a legal entity. The GLN is part of the GS1 system of standards.

Columns.Name: DunsNumber
Columns.Description: The DUNS number is a nine-digit number issued by Dun & Bradstreet and assigned to each business location in the D&B database having a unique, separate, and distinct operation to businesses for the purpose of identifying them. The number as issued is random and the digits apparently have no significance as to their issuance.

Columns.Name: DunBradstreetSingleLocationSubsidiary
Columns.Description:
There are eight (8) types of business relationships defined in D&B WorldBase:

Single Location Subsidiary

A single location subsidiary has reporting responsibilities to its parent; however, it does not have branches or subsidiaries reporting to it. Do not confuse this with a stand-alone business which is titled "single location" and is not part of a corporate family.

Headquarters

A headquarters is a business establishment that has branches or divisions reporting to it, and is financially responsible for those branches or divisions. If the headquarters is more that 50% owned by another corporation, it also will be a subsidiary. If it owns more that 50% of another corporation, then it is also a parent.

Branch

A branch is a secondary location of its headquarters. It has no legal responsibility for its debts, even though bills may be paid from the branch location. It will have the same legal business name as its headquarters, although branches frequently operate under a different trade style than the headquarters establishment. A branch may be located at the same address as the headquarters if it has a unique trade style. In such cases, the branch may appear to be a duplicate with a different D-U-N-S number than the headquarters record, which may confuse customers if they don't purchase the trade style field.

Division

A division, like a branch, is a secondary location of a business. However, a division carries out specific business operations related to the headquarters under a divisional name. Divisions look similar to branches in D&B WorldBase and carry a branch code.

Subsidiary

A subsidiary is a corporation that is more than 50% owned by another corporation and will have a different legal business name from its parent company. A subsidiary may have branches and/or subsidiaries of its own. If it does, then its D-U-N-S Number appears in the headquarter/parent D-U-N-S Number field of its children.

Parent

A parent is a corporation that owns more than 50 percent of another corporation. The parent company also may be a subsidiary of another corporation. If the parent also has branches, then it is also a headquarters.

Domestic Ultimate

The Domestic Ultimate is a subsidiary within the global family tree which is the highest ranking member within a specific country.

Global Ultimate

The Global Ultimate is the top most responsible entity within the global family tree. The Global Ultimate may have branches and/or subsidiaries reporting directly or indirectly to it.

Parent

A parent is a corporation that owns more than 50 percent of another corporation. The parent company also may be a subsidiary of another corporation. If the parent also has branches, then it is also a headquarters.

Domestic Ultimate

The Domestic Ultimate is a subsidiary within the global family tree which is the highest ranking member within a specific country.

Global Ultimate

The Global Ultimate is the top most responsible entity within the global family tree. A branch is a secondary location of its headquarters. It has no legal responsibility for its debts, even though bills may be paid from the branch location. Columns.Name: ManufacturerLotId
Columns.Description: The unique identifier of a Manufacturer Lot.

Columns.Name: ItemSku
Columns.Description: The Stock Keeping Unit identifier, which is typically used for inventory-related activities.

Columns.Name: Quantity
Columns.Description: The quantity of non-serialized items in the Manufacturer Lot.

Columns.Name: MinimumSerialNumber
Columns.Description: The minimum (low) serial number of products included in the manufacturer item lot.

Columns.Name: MaximumSerialNumber
Columns.Description: The maximum (high) serial number of products included in the manufacturer item lot.

Columns.Name: ManufacturedPeriodStartDate
Columns.Description: The starting manufactured date of products included in the manufacturer item lot.

Columns.Name: ManufacturedPeriodEndDate
Columns.Description: The ending manufactured date of products included in the manufacturer item lot.

Columns.Name: BestBeforeDate
Columns.Description: The date before which the item is best used. This does not imply that the item has expired, just that the product is no longer at its best.

Columns.Name: ExpiryDate
Columns.Description: The date after which the item has expired and should not be used.

Columns.Name: ManufacturerLotNote
Columns.Description: A note, comment or additional information regarding the Manufacturer Lot.

Columns.Name: ManufacturerFacilityId
Columns.Description: The unique identifier of a Manufacturer Facility.

Columns.Name: CountryOfOriginId
Columns.Description: The unique identifier of the Country.

NewEntity.Name: RockSampleType
NewEntity.Description:
The type of sample.

Ex:
- Core Sample
- Back Sample
- Bulk Sample
- Channel Sample
- Chip Sample
- Point Sample
- Linear Sample
- Panel Sample

where:

CORE SAMPLE
A cylindrical section of (usually) a naturally occurring substance. Most core samples are obtained by drilling with special drills into the substance.

BACK SAMPLE
Rock chips collected from the roof or back of an underground opening for the purpose of determining grade.

BULK SAMPLE
A large sample of mineralized rock, frequently hundreds of tonnes, selected in such a manner as to be representative of the potential orebody being sampled. Used to determine metallurgical characteristics.  

CHANNEL SAMPLE
A sample composed of pieces of vein or mineral deposit that have been cut out of a small trench or channel, usually about 10 cm wide and 2 cm deep.  

CHIP SAMPLE
A method of sampling a rock exposure whereby a regular series of small chips of rock is broken off along a line across the face.  

POINT SAMPLES
This is can be a single grab sample chosen to represent some mass; or it can be random samples taken from various source points, generally within a predetermined area, and can be either in two dimensions or three dimensions (i.e. dump pile) and composited.

LINEAR SAMPLES
Continuous sampling over an interval in a line such as channel samples or drill hole samples, and profile sampling of overburden.

PANEL SAMPLES
These are planar samples made up of multiple chips collected from a surface with dimensions (i.e. one by two meters).

Columns.Name: SampleTypeId
Columns.Description: The unique identifier of a sample type.

Columns.Name: SampleTypeName
Columns.Description: The name of a sample type.

Columns.Name: SampleTypeDescription
Columns.Description: The description of a sample type.

A method of sampling a rock exposure whereby a regular series of small chips of rock is broken off along a line across the face.  

POINT SAMPLES
This is can be a single grab sample chosen to represent some mass; or it can be random samples taken from various source points, generally within a predetermined area, and can be either in two dimensions or three dimensions (i.e. dump pile) and composited.

LINEAR SAMPLES
Continuous sampling over an interval in a line such as channel samples or drill hole samples, and profile sampling of overburden.

PANEL SAMPLES
These are planar samples made up of multiple chips collected from a surface with dimensions (i.e. one by two meters).
